alert.note: Alert for Gray (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 13 at 5:15PM CDT until August 13 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR WHEELER...SOUTHEASTERN GRAY...NORTHERN COLLINGSWORTH... SOUTHEASTERN HEMPHILL AND NORTHEASTERN DONLEY COUNTIES... At 514 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Allison to 9 miles northeast of Twitty to 9 miles west of Dozier, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Locations impacted include... Shamrock, Briscoe, Wheeler, Mclean, Lutie, Twitty, Allison, Dozier, Lela, Samnorwood, and Kellerville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
